member.name: T:Ace.Core.Client.Controls.Grouping.GenericComparer
member.summary: Comparer that tries to find the 'strongest' comparer for a type. if the type implements a generic IComparable, that is used. otherwise if it implements a normal IComparable, that is used. If neither are implemented, the ToString versions are compared. INullable structures are also supported. This way, the DefaultComparer can compare any object types and can be used for sorting any source.

member.summary: This class is a wrapper around an event descriptor. It will be used in the PropertyGrid to display an event as a property. member.name: T:Ace.Core.Client.IAceClientPlugin
member.summary: An interface implemented by client-side ACE plugins. Classes implementing this interface are automatically discovered at client startup, and the Initialize() method called. After all plugins have been created, the Prepare method is then called so the plugin can perform any initialization that is required after all plugins have been initialized. At shutdown, the Dispose() method is called. There are no guarantees as to which order plugins are initialized or disposed.

member.summary: Remove a tool strip from the toolbar

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Client.IGuiHost.GetToolStrip(System.String)
member.summary: Get the tool strip with the specified name
member.param: The name of the tool strip.
member.returns: The tool strip, or null if none was found
member.remarks: The ToolStrip::Name property of all tool strips is searched. The one with the matching name is returned. This is not the name used for display.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Client.IPlugInOptionsControl
member.summary: Base class for all GUIPlugin Options Display Controls.
member.remarks: If a GUIPlugin needs to add an Options tab to the options form display to allow access to user level properties, you need to do the following: 1) Create a Settings file for your project. Make sure all settings are marked as user level settings so they can be both read/write. 2) Create a UserControl to display the settings and change the base class to derive from this class. 3) Add the attribute ObjectEditorAttribute to the user's GuiPlugin object. That provides the link between the plug-in and the options display control

member.summary: The Cancel button has been pressed. Changes to options should be discarded

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Client.GuiUtil.IsDesignerHosted(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified control is hosted in a Designer. http://dotnetfacts.blogspot.com/2009/01/identifying-run-time-and-design-mode.html http://www.david-gouveia.com/problems-with-designmode-in-winforms/
member.returns: true if the specified control is hosted in a Designer; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Client.GuiUtil.RegisterControlForLateInit(System.Windows.Forms.UserControl,System.Windows.Forms.Control,Ace.Core.Client.CustomTypeDescriptorBase)
member.summary:
Registers an inner control for a late initialization. This method must be used when a user control is inheriting from another control, and when some inner controls of the parent control are exposed and serialized by the designer. In this particular case, we do not want the Size and Location properties of the inner controls to be set before the layout logic has completed, as it may lead to some inner control being moved twice. So we will record the values of the properties of the inner control during the initialization phase, and push them to the inner controls when the user control will be loaded. See bug 9045. This has been extended with bug 9153: we will now delay every property that will be set by the Designer.
Three situations must be handled: - Control creation, when it is dropped on the Design surface We must keep the initial values of the inner control - Control deserialization (at loading, when it is deserialized by the Designer -or- at run-time, when it is compiled en executed) We must apply the changes generated by the Designer. The tricky thing is that the Designer will generate some code only for the property that differ from their default value. So we have to set the default values to the initial values of the inner control, to be sure that we will detect any changes made by the user.
member.param: The custom type descriptor of the inner control. It wil be used to filter the properties to consider.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Client.GuiUtil.GetLateInitControl``1(``0)
member.summary: Gets the late initialization control.
member.returns: The late initialization control.

member.returns: The enumeration value corresponding to the string representation.

member.returns: Is the value relative to the enumeration

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.ParseTypeConverter.ConvertFrom(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Converts from a string to an object formed by calling the static "Parse" static method.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute
member.summary: A class attribute that flags a class so that it may be added to 'pick lists' for creating new objects.
member.remarks:
The path to be displayed in pick lists must be defined in a resource file specified in AssemblyInfo.cs by the line:
[assembly: ResourceFile("PickList", "Ace.Core.Client.PickList")]
where "Ace.Core.Client.PickList" is replaced by the actual resource file name. In that file, the key "Classname" should contain a line containing the path of the program in the pick list, where each folder is delimited by a vertical-bar ('|') character. For example, corresponding to the key "MyClass" might be the value "Motion|My Class", where "My Class" will appear in the "Motion" folder in the pick list.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute.GetPath(System.Type)
member.summary: Return the pick list path for the item of given type.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute.GetPath(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return the pick list path for the item of given type.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute.GetPath(System.Object)
member.summary: Return the pick list path for the item.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute.GetDefaultName(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the default name for the specified object
member.returns: The default name

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute.GetDefaultName(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the default name for the specified object type
member.returns: The default name

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute.GetPickListAttribute(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the PickList attribute for the given type, or null if not defined.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute.HasCreationWizard(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns true if the type has a creation wizard.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute.GetBasePathFor(System.Type)

Attribute that is used during load time for a workspace. If a class is moved or renamed, this attribute can be applied to the class after the change to instruct the loading sequence to redirect older references to the object to this new object.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.RemotingUtil.CreateClientChannels(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create client side communications channels. Currently there are 2 connection channels created: 'ipc' and 'tcp'. For each channel type, 2 channels are needed. One is tied to a specific port so a server can access event objects on the server on a callbback channel. The other is used to connect the client to the server.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.TextUtil.StringToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string to bytes. If a unicode character is encountered, 0x0200 (unicode start byte + null byte) is inserted in the byte array before writing the character. When the next ASCII character is encountered, 0x0300 (unicode end byte + null byte) is again inserted in the byte array before writing the ASCII character.
member.returns: array of bytes

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.TextUtil.BytesToString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts bytes to a string. If a byte array with unicode characters is received, we extract the characters using ASCII encoding until 0x0200 (unicode start byte + null byte) is encountered. Then, extract the subsequent characters using Unicode encoding until 0x0300 (unicode end byte + null byte) is encountered.
member.returns: string containing unicode characters

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.TextUtil.ConvertASCIIByteToUnicodeBytes(System.Byte)
member.summary: Converts an ASCII 1-byte character to its equivalent unicode 2-byte representation
member.returns: 2-byte unicode representation of the ASCII character

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Util.TftpServer
member.summary: Simple TFTP Server. Supports multiple concurrent clients.
member.remarks:
Booting a SmartController from TFTP:
Disable autoboot with the hardware or software DIP switches.
At the prompt for the boot device, enter "X" and either Enter (load and go), ^J (verbose load and go), or ^L (verbose load and not go).
Enter the IP address of the TFTP host (in "dotted-decimal" format).
Enter the path to the V+ system on the TFTP host. For example: C:\Adept\Disks\Disk_C\V1603\
SW1 Settings:
SW 1 SW 2 SW 3 SW 4 Interpretation ON ON ON ON No auto boot, all other settings per CompactFlash OFF ON ON ON No auto boot, user interface via serial port ON ON OFF ON No auto boot, user interface via Ethernet AdeptWindows (use IP address in CompactFlash) OFF ON OFF ON No auto boot, user interface via Ethernet AdeptWindows (use default IP address) OFF OFF OFF OFF Operation per CompactFlash and NVRAM settings

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the thread.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the scheduling priority of a thread.
member.value: One of the System.Threading.ThreadPriority values. The default value is Normal.

member.summary: Gets a value containing the states of the current thread.
member.value: One of the System.Threading.ThreadState values indicating the state of the current thread. The initial value is Unstarted.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Abort
member.summary: Raises a System.Threading.ThreadAbortException in the thread on which it is invoked, to begin the process of terminating the thread. Calling this method usually terminates the thread.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Abort(System.Object)
member.summary: Raises a System.Threading.ThreadAbortException in the thread on which it is invoked, to begin the process of terminating the thread. Calling this method usually terminates the thread.
member.param: An object that contains application-specific information, such as state, which can be used by the thread being aborted

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Interrupt
member.summary: Interrupts a thread that is in the WaitSleepJoin thread state.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Join
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until a thread terminates, while continuing to perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Join(System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until a thread terminates or the specified time elapses, while continuing to perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait for the thread to terminate.
member.returns: /// true if the thread terminated; false if the thread has not terminated after the amount of time specified by the timeout parameter has elapsed.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Join(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until a thread terminates or the specified time elapses, while continuing to perform standard COM and SendMessage pumping.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait for the thread to terminate.
member.returns: true if the thread terminated; false if the thread has not terminated after the amount of time specified by the timeout parameter has elapsed.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Start
member.summary: Causes the operating system to change the state of the current instance to System.Threading.ThreadState.Running.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Start(System.Object)
member.summary: Causes the operating system to change the state of the current instance to System.Threading.ThreadState.Running, and optionally supplies an object containing data to be used by the method the thread executes.
member.param: An object that contains data to be used by the method the thread executes.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.CurrentContext
member.summary: Gets the current context in which the thread is executing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the culture for the current thread.
member.value: A System.Globalization.CultureInfo representing the culture for the current thread.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.CurrentPrincipal
member.summary: Gets or sets the thread's current principal (for role-based security).
member.value: An System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal value representing the security context.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.CurrentThread
member.summary: Gets the currently running thread.
member.value: A System.Threading.Thread that is the representation of the currently running thread.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current culture used by the Resource Manager to look up culture-specific resources at run time.
member.value: A System.Globalization.CultureInfo representing the current culture.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.ExecutionContext
member.summary: Gets an System.Threading.ExecutionContext object that contains information about the various contexts of the current thread.
member.value: An System.Threading.ExecutionContext object that consolidates context information for the current thread.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.AllocateDataSlot
member.summary: Allocates an unnamed data slot on all the threads. For better performance, use fields that are marked with the System.ThreadStaticAttribute attribute instead.
member.returns: A System.LocalDataStoreSlot.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.AllocateNamedDataSlot(System.String)
member.summary: Allocates an unnamed data slot on all the threads. For better performance, use fields that are marked with the System.ThreadStaticAttribute attribute instead.
member.param: The name of the data slot to be allocated.
member.returns: A System.LocalDataStoreSlot.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.BeginCriticalRegion
member.summary: Notifies a host that execution is about to enter a region of code in which the effects of a thread abort or unhandled exception might jeopardize other tasks in the application domain.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.BeginThreadAffinity
member.summary: Notifies a host that managed code is about to execute instructions that depend on the identity of the current physical operating system thread.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.DisableComObjectEagerCleanup
member.summary: Turns off automatic cleanup of runtime callable wrappers (RCW) for the current thread.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.EndCriticalRegion
member.summary: Notifies a host that execution is about to enter a region of code in which the effects of a thread abort or unhandled exception are limited to the current task.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.EndThreadAffinity
member.summary: Notifies a host that managed code has finished executing instructions that depend on the identity of the current physical operating system thread.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.FreeNamedDataSlot(System.String)
member.summary: Eliminates the association between a name and a slot, for all threads in the process. For better performance, use fields that are marked with the System.ThreadStaticAttribute attribute instead.
member.param: The name of the data slot to be freed.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.GetApartmentState
member.summary: Returns an System.Threading.ApartmentState value indicating the apartment state.
member.returns: One of the System.Threading.ApartmentState values indicating the apartment state of the managed thread. The default is System.Threading.ApartmentState.Unknown.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.GetData(System.LocalDataStoreSlot)
member.summary: Retrieves the value from the specified slot on the current thread, within the current thread's current domain. For better performance, use fields that are marked with the System.ThreadStaticAttribute attribute instead.
member.param: The System.LocalDataStoreSlot from which to get the value.
member.returns: The retrieved value.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.GetDomain
member.summary: Returns the current domain in which the current thread is running.
member.returns: An System.AppDomain representing the current application domain of the running thread.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.GetDomainID
member.summary: Returns a unique application domain identifier.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer uniquely identifying the application domain.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for the current thread.
member.returns: An integer hash code value.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.GetNamedDataSlot(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up a named data slot. For better performance, use fields that are marked with the System.ThreadStaticAttribute attribute instead.
member.param: The name of the local data slot.
member.returns: A System.LocalDataStoreSlot allocated for this thread.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.MemoryBarrier
member.summary: Synchronizes memory access as follows: The processor executing the current thread cannot reorder instructions in such a way that memory accesses prior to the call to System.Threading.Thread.MemoryBarrier() execute after memory accesses that follow the call to System.Threading.Thread.MemoryBarrier().

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.ResetAbort
member.summary: Cancels an System.Threading.Thread.Abort(System.Object) requested for the current thread.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.SetApartmentState(System.Threading.ApartmentState)
member.summary: Sets the apartment state of a thread before it is started.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.SetData(System.LocalDataStoreSlot,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the data in the specified slot on the currently running thread, for that thread's current domain. For better performance, use fields marked with the System.ThreadStaticAttribute attribute instead.
member.param: The System.LocalDataStoreSlot in which to set the value.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Sleep(System.Int32)
member.summary: Suspends the current thread for a specified time.
member.param: The number of milliseconds for which the thread is blocked. Specify zero (0) to indicate that this thread should be suspended to allow other waiting threads to execute. Specify System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite to block the thread indefinitely.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.Sleep(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Blocks the current thread for a specified time.
member.param: A System.TimeSpan set to the amount of time for which the thread is blocked. Specify zero to indicate that this thread should be suspended to allow other waiting threads to execute. Specify System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite to block the thread indefinitely.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.SafeThread.SpinWait(System.Int32)
member.summary: Causes a thread to wait the number of times defined by the iterations parameter.
member.param: A 32-bit signed integer that defines how long a thread is to wait.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.DataItems.ExposableDataItemWrapper
member.summary:
Represents a data item wrapper that can be set in the propertyGrid control.
It contains a reference to the exposable data item and the corresponding exposable data source.
When an object is added to the propertyGrid, we have to update the propertyGrid when the values of the object change. This require to change the object displayed by the propertyGrid.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Event.PropertyFinder
member.summary: Utility class used to find property change events being processed by the SafeEvent class.
member.remarks: Sometimes a property can be modified many times in a short period of time. This class is used to see if a property change event is already in the queue to send to the client. In this case, the event does not need to be added to the remote event queue.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent
member.summary: A "safe" event class that performs two critical functions. First, it drops event handlers that throw exceptions. This is very important to do when events are reported using .NET remoting, since errors occur if the remote client is disconnected, but we don't want to stop other clients from receiving messages. Second, it will optionally report events in a background thread to avoid delaying critical threads. It spear ates the events into 2 categorizes: events local to the current application doman and events remote to the domain. Events that are local to the application domain are always thrown in-line. Remote events are always thrown in a background thread.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.EventDetails
member.summary: Tracking class holding information about a remote event that is being processed

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.#cctor
member.summary: Starts the background invocation thread.

member.summary: Create a "safe" event for the specified handler.
member.param: The delegate/handler to be called when the event is raised.

member.summary: Returns the descriptive string passed into the constructor.

member.summary: Raise an event with the specified arguments in the current thread, handling all exceptions by removing the invoker from the execution list.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.
member.returns: The identifier associated with the event.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.Raise(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raise an event with the specified arguments in the current thread.
member.param: if set to true the exception is automatically handled. If set to false, any exceptions encountered are re-thrown so they can be handled by the caller.
if set to true the events local to the current application domain will be thrown.
if set to true the events not local to the current application domain will be thrown.
The instance containing the event data.
member.returns: The identifier associated with the event.

member.summary: Raise an event with the specified arguments in the current thread.

The instance containing the event data.
if set to true the event handlers are local. If false, the events are remote

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEventPump
member.summary: Manage a queue of events for sending to the SafeEvent handler.
member.remarks: This should be used for high frequency events between the server and client process. The SafeEvent object can only queue up a limited number of events. If it gets saturated, the system can lock up. This class uses a background thread to meter a collection of events to the SafeEvent object, eliminating the stack up of events.

member.summary: An event fired when the task state changes.

member.summary: An event fired when the task state changes.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Program.Task.CurrentTask
member.summary: The task currently executing in this thread, or null if no task is executing.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Program.Task.CheckError
member.summary: Check for an error in this task. If CurrentTask is null, does nothing.
member.returns: true if an error was handled.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Program.Task.Sleep(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sleep for the specified number of milliseconds. If CurrentTask is not null, this ensures that CheckError() is called.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Program.Task.RequestValue(Ace.Core.Server.IAceObject,System.String)
member.summary: Request the user to provide a value. Allows retry or abort.
member.example:
This is usually called in a loop like:
while (myValue == null) RequestValue(this, "My Value");
member.param: The object whose value is undefined.
A description associated with the message.
member.returns: User response code. If abort was selected, and exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Program.Task.PostMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Post a message to the current task. If not executing as a task, does nothing.
member.param: Message to send to user interface.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Program.Task.Pause(Ace.Core.Server.IAceObject,System.String)
member.summary: Pause to wait for operator to perform an operation. Allows proceed or abort.
member.param: The object whose value is undefined.
A description associated with the message.
member.returns: User response code. If abort was selected, and exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Program.Task.ReportException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Report an exception to the user. If CurrentTask is null, simply throws the exception.
member.returns: User response code. If abort was selected, and exception is thrown.

member.summary: Specifies an access level for a class or property.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttributeHelper.GetAccess(System.Type,System.String,Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Return the allowed access mode for the given type, property and user level. The access level may be specified in the application configuration file (such as "Ace.exe.config"). However, if a more restrictive access attribute is specified in the source code for that class or property, then the more restrictive value is used.
member.example:
In the first line of the following example, write access is limited to the "Ace.CartesianObject" class to users with access level "OemCustomizer" or above. In the second line, read access is limited to the "Parent" property to users with access level engineer or above. The property will be invisible to others. These lines should be placed in the "AccessSection" section of the application configuration file:
<AccessElement name="Ace.CartesianObject" writeAccess="OemCustomizer"/> <AccessElement name="Ace.CartesianObject_Parent" readAccess="Engineer"/>
member.param: Property name to check (or null for class itself).
member.returns: Allowed access mode.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttributeHelper.VerifyReadAccess(System.Type,Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Throws an exception if the specified object's class may NOT be viewed from the GUI.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Access.SentinelDongle
member.summary: Class for holding Sentinel Super Pro information.
member.remarks:
The class uses a symbol called "USE_DONGLE". This must be set in the project properties for the dongle check to be enabled. Here is a description of protection scheme : PHYSICAL DONGLE LAYOUT ( matrix of 8 x 8 memory cells of 16 bits )
0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 0 : | serial # | dev id | reserved | reserved | reserved | reserved | reserved | reserved | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1 : | 08 | 09 | 0A | 0B | 0C | 0D | 0E | 0F | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 2 : | 10 | 11 | 12 | 13 | 14 | 15 | 16 | 17 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3 : | 18 | 19 | 1A | 1B | 1C | 1D | 1E | 1F | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 4 : | 20 | 21 | 22 | 23 | 24 | 25 | 26 | 27 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 5 : | 28 | 29 | 2A | 2B | 2C | 2D | 2E | 2F | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 6 : | 30 | 31 | 32 | 33 | 34 | 35 | 36 | 37 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 7 : | 38 | 39 | 3A | 3B | 3C | 3D | 3E | 3F | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The first row is reserved The 4 first columns are used for encryption algorithms The rows 4 and 6 are used to stored data and 5 and 7 to store encrypted counterpart
We can protect 8 different software
1 : start at 0C ( first 10 bits are for version ), other 6 for options, and 16 other options at 0E 2 : start at 14 ( first 10 bits are for version ), other 6 for options, and 16 other options at 16 3 : start at 1C ( first 10 bits are for version ), other 6 for options 4 : start at 1E ...
34 : 16 most significant bits of serial number ( p/n portion ) 36 : 16 less significant bits of serial number ( p/n portion ) 3C : serial number sequential number ( i/d portion )
3E : memory cell includes global expiration date if appropriate
3F : 8 first bits ( DONGLE VERSION ) 8 last bits ( reserved for future use )

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.AceServer.EmulationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ACE server is running in emulation mode. As we do not want to end up with a root collection that is a mix of real and emulated objects, we only allow to switch the emulation mode if the root collection is empty. The emulation mode can not be set at true if there is no EmulationMode license.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.AceServer.SaveLocalWorkspace
member.summary: Saves the workspace file in the case client and server are on the same PC.
member.exception: Workspace is not loaded

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.AceServer.SaveLocalWorkspace(System.String,System.EventHandler{Ace.Core.Server.Event.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Saves the workspace files in the case client and server are on the same PC. Instead of using .NET remoting to transfer the workspace file content from server to client, this method directly transfers the path to a temporary file containing the data. This method allows a better efficiency to transfer the data from server to client but it must NOT be called if server and client are on different PCs.
member.returns: The path to a temporary file in which client side workspace is saved.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.AceServer.SaveWorkspace(System.Boolean,System.String,System.EventHandler{Ace.Core.Server.Event.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Saves the workspace files in the case client and server are on the same PC. Instead of using .NET remoting to transfer the workspace file content from server to client, this method directly transfers the path to a temporary file containing the data. This method allows a better efficiency to transfer the data from server to client but it must NOT be called if server and client are on different PCs.
member.returns: The path to a temporary file or content of the file in bytes array in which client side workspace is saved.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.RemotableClientObject

member.summary: The instance of AceClient associated with this object.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The ace client associated with the object.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.RemotableClientObject.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a flag that ensures that the object will eventually be inaccessible remotely, allowing it to be garbage-collected.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector
member.summary: Defines core end-effector behaviors. Performs the logic for simple grip and release operations.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.Robot
member.summary: Gets the robot to which this end-effector is attached, or null if not attached to a robot.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.Payload
member.summary: Gets or sets the payload or weight of the gripper in kg.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.Clear
member.summary: Clear the end-effector of parts.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.State
member.summary: Grip or release an object using the selected tip. The value is true when the end-effector is gripping an object.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.MaxGripTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time allowed for the grip to be verified, in seconds.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.TipRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the tip radius used to draw the tip in the virtual display.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.WaitGrip(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates whether the gripper state is verified to be set properly, as indicated by whether IsPartPresent returns the desired state within the max grip time.
member.param: Desired part-present state, true if part should be present.
member.returns: true if the actual part-present state matches the desired one.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.TransferStateChange(System.Boolean,Ace.Core.Server.Motion.TransferState)
member.summary: Called by the pick-place strategy to indicate a change change during pick-place operations. By default, sets the grip state to be "true" at completion of a pick move, and "false" at the completion of a place move. Override this method to change the logic.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.ToolOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the tool offset of the selected tip, by appending the difference between the current tool offset and the desired one to the tip offset.
Gets or sets the tool offset of this end-effector. By default, set does nothing.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.TipCenterline
member.summary: The centerline of the end-effector tips

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.Count
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of parts that this end-effector can hold. Setting this value will clear any existing tip information.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.DisposePart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Dispose of the current part in the end-effector.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.Part
member.summary: Gets or sets the part held by this device. If the device holds multiple parts, this returns the selected part. It does NOT remove the part from this device.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Get or set the current index into the array of parts.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.EndEffectorTips
member.summary: Gets a collection of end-effector tips used to hold parts.

member.summary: Adds the end-effector tip.

member.summary: Deletes the end-effector tip.

member.summary: Selects the center line of the gripper.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IAbstractEndEffector.UpdateToolOffset
member.summary: Updates the tool offset.

member.summary: An event raised when the object is modified.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IEndEffectorTip.AddReferences(Ace.Core.Server.ReferenceCollection)
member.summary: Returns all IReference objects referred to by this object. This will ensure that the references are properly handled during initialization, deletion, etc. You must override this method in objects that contain LinkedReference or EmbeddedReference objects.

member.summary: Initializes this end-effector tip.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IEndEffectorTip.IsPartPresent
member.summary: Gets a flag indicating whether a part is present on the end-effector. If a grip input sensor is specified, returns the sensor's value; otherwise returns the commanded grip state.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IEndEffectorTip.GripState
member.summary: Gets or sets the grip state of end-effector (true to grip, false to release).

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Device.IEndEffectorTip.TipOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the tip offset from the end-effector base to this end-effector tip.

member.summary: Gets or sets the object held by this end-effector tip.

member.summary: Dispose of the current part in the end-effector.

member.summary: Tip name to display on UI

member.exception: Workspace is not loaded

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.IAceServer.SaveLocalWorkspace(System.String,System.EventHandler{Ace.Core.Server.Event.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Saves the workspace files in the case client and server are on the same PC. Instead of using .NET remoting to transfer the workspace file content from server to client, this method directly transfers the path to a temporary file containing the data. This method allows a better efficiency to transfer the data from server to client but it must NOT be called if server and client are on different PCs.
member.returns: The path to a temporary file in which client side workspace is saved.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.ICartesianObject
member.summary: An object in the work cell with a Cartesian location. Objects that extend this class may build a "scene graph" of connections to define their location. For example, a robot may be mounted to a table, an end-effector to the robot, and a part attached to the end-effector. So the location of the object may be determined by appending the location of its parent (if any) with its offset. Cartesian objects may be rendered in 3D simulations.
member.remarks: A user application will typically not use this interface.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.ICartesianObject.ParentLocation
member.summary: World location of the parent of this object, or the identity transform if this object has no parent.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Euler
member.summary: Defines the order of Euler angles that are supported by the Transform3D class.

member.name: F:Ace.Core.Server.Euler.Xyz
member.summary: X-Y-Z Euler angles, in which the order of rotations is a rotation about X, followed by a rotation about the "new" Y axis after the initial rotation, followed by a rotation about the "new" Z axis.

member.name: F:Ace.Core.Server.Euler.Zyz
member.summary: Z-Y-Z Euler angles, in which the order of rotations is a rotation about Z, followed by a rotation about the "new" Y axis after the initial rotation, followed by a rotation about the "new" Z axis.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D
member.summary: A "homogeneous transformation", which describes the offset and orientation of one XYZ coordinate system from another as a single entity.
member.remarks:
An affine, non-scaling transform may be written as
[ xAxis.X yAxis.X zAxis.X offset.X ] [ xAxis.Y yAxis.Y zAxis.Y offset.Y ] [ xAxis.Z yAxis.Z zAxis.Z offset.Z ] [ 0 0 0 1 ]
where xAxis, yAxis, and zAxis are unit vectors specifying the new XYZ axes in the coordinate system of the old XYZ axes, and offset specifies the offset of the new origin from the old origin, along the old axes. A Transform3D is immutable--once defined, it cannot be changed. This makes it behave much as a value type.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D.GetLabels(Ace.Core.Server.Euler)
member.summary: Returns a collection of labels associated with the array values returned by ToArray(Euler).

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D.DefaultEulerAngles
member.summary: Default Euler angles selection used when displaying and converting transforms. The default is "Z-Y-Z".

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D.Identity
member.summary: An identity transform.

member.summary: Returns true the components of two transforms are identical.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D.op_Inequality(Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D,Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D)
member.summary: Returns true the components of two transforms are NOT identical.

member.summary: Returns a new transform, rotated by specified degrees about the Y axis from this transform.

member.summary: Returns a transform representing a rotation about the Z axis.
